required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High-Intensity Interval Training on Pre-Hypertensive Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Health Status Factors Predicting Responses to Long-Term Training: Effects of 16-Week High-Intensity Interval Training on Pre-Hypertensive Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Despite exercise training decrease blood pressure in 'average' terms, there is a wide interindividual variability after exercise training, being yet unknown what mode of exercise (e.g. endurance, strength, concurrent, or high intensity interval training) produce more/less non-responder (NR) prevalence (i.e., percentage of subjects who experienced a non-change/worsened response after training in some outcome).

detailed_description.textblock: Despite exercise training decrease blood pressure in 'average' terms, there is a wide interindividual variability after exercise training, being yet unknown what mode of exercise (e.g. endurance, strength, concurrent, or high intensity interval training) produce more/less non-responder (NR) prevalence (i.e., percentage of subjects who experienced a non-change/worsened response after training in some outcome).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
primary_outcome.description: After this, we calculated the delta changes in both variables and classified to all subjects in responders (R) and non-responders (NR) to decrease systolic or diastolic blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in body mass
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in body mass index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: BMI will be calculated as the body weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in waist circumference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in fat mass
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in heart rate at rest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in fasting glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid profile (low-density cholesterol, total cholesterol, high-density cholesterol and triglycerides)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in one maximum repetition strength test of leg-extension exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 16 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

arm_group.description: Cycling on cycle ergometers (OXFORDTM, model BE2601, OXOFORD Inc, Santiago, Chile) for 1 min at a subjective intensity of 8-10 points of the modified Borg scale of 1-10 points, and interspersed by inactive (without movement over the bicycle) of 2 minutes as recovery period.

Pre-hypertensive group was compared with healthy groups in the 2 manin variables systolic/diastolic blood pressure, as well as in other co-variables in pre-post changes. Thus, after the training intervention, and following the R and NR classification, we will compare the NR prevalence between both Pre-hypertensive and Healthy group.

intervention.description: High Intensity Interval Training pre-hypertensive group; Exercise will be performed at three sessions per week. All sessions will be supervised by an exercise physiologist during 16 weeks.
Moderade Intensity Interval Training pre-hypertensive group; Exercise will be performed at three sessions per week. All sessions will be supervised by an exercise physiologist during 16 weeks.
